intro: Costularia itremoensis, commonly known as the Madagascar costularia, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It has opposite leaves that are usually elliptical or ovate in shape. Costularia itremoensis is often found in shaded, humid environments within the rainforest understory.
